newsitem.title: USA: NBC leads U.S. TV ratings at season start.
newsitem.headline: NBC leads U.S. TV ratings at season start.

text.p: General Electric Co unit NBC took the top spot, attracting the biggest evening-hours audiences, during the first week of the 1996-97 U.S. television season which ended on Sunday.

According to Neilsen Media Research, Westinghouse Electric Corp's CBS held second place and the ABC network owned by Walt Disney Co was third in the number of homes tuned to its evening-hours programs.
The FOX network owned by News Corp Ltd was fourth.
For the week which ended on Sunday:
-- NBC drew on average 11.8 rating, or percentage, of America's 97 million homes with televisions, and a 20 percent share of homes watching television during those hours;
-- CBS had a rating or 10.8 on average and an 18 percent share of homes watching television;
-- ABC's average rating was 9.9 and its share was 17 percent;
-- FOX had a 6.3 rating and a 10 percent share of audiences;
-- UPN, a unit of Chris-Craft Industries allied with Viacom Inc, had a rating of 3.4 and a share of five percent;
-- WB, a unit of Time Warner Inc, had a 2.6 rating and a four percent share.
